attributes.action: British Govt to apologise for the Jallianwala Bagh Massacre of 1919 100 years on
attributes.background: On 13th April 1919, a crowd of 10,000 unarmed men, women & children were gathered peacefully in Jallianwala Bagh, Amritsar. British troops, led by General Dyer, opened fire without warning, killing hundreds of people & children as young as six months old. The British Govt has never apologised.
